id_field.descriptions: Variable part of the subject, data-field name

id_source.description: Source of the variable subject part ('dict' or 'marc')

id_fallback.description: alternative part of the variable subject

source.description: Source of the field, either dict or marc

field.description: Name of the data-field that gets converted to the object

required.description: designates whether a field is needed for the graph or not

type.description: Designates if the final triple has a triple as object or a literal

alternatives.description: If 'field' cannot be found alternatives is used as direct standin

mapping.description: Replaces a given value with the other side of the map.

joined_map.description: Map that defines the replacing predicate from 'joined_field

joined_field.description: A data-field that is used in combination with 'joined_map' to replace the predicate

joined_map_ref.description: referenced file for additional mappings in 'joined_field'

match.description: Regex String, matching function, filters out string that do not match regex

append.description: Adds text after the objects value

prepend.description: Adds text before the objects value

cut.description: Deletes every instance of the string found described

replace.description: inserts the text of this field into every part that was removed by 'cut

insert_into.description: Inserts the object value at the placeholder position in this string

insert_add_fields.description: Additional values that can be inserted in additional 'insert_string' placeholder

if_field.description: Data-field that is used in the left side of a comparison

if_value.description: Right side of the comparion that is compared against 'if_field'

fallback.description: recursive node if the first one does not match

comment.description: Provided commentary that is not used for the actual mapping but can provide context for analysis tools

name.description: Name for a node, is not used for any processing

sub_node.description: Copy & Paste of root_node but with two less requirements
